alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 9:59AM CDT until May 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Dakota, Carver, Scott and Hennepin Counties. .Additional rainfall over the last 24 hours has kept river levels in flood stage. With thunderstorms in the forecast over the weekend, river levels will have to be monitored closely. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading stops at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Thursday, the stage was 702.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 AM CDT Thursday was 703.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 697.4 feet next Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 702.8 feet on 10/01/1986. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
